reading_passages.title: About History of Modern Europe
reading_passages.text: Lesson 1 Big Idea New inventions and knowledge led to European exploration and empires around the world. Main Ideas •During the Scientific Revolution, discoveries and inventions expanded knowledge and changed life in Europe.
reading_passages.main_idea: Lesson 1 Big Idea New inventions and knowledge led to European exploration and empires around the world.
supporting_details: Main Ideas •During the Scientific Revolution, discoveries and inventions expanded knowledge and changed life in Europe.

reading_passages.title: About History of Modern Europe
reading_passages.text: In the 1400s and 1500s, Europeans led voyages of discovery and exploration.
reading_passages.main_idea: In the 1400s and 1500s, Europeans led voyages of discovery and exploration.

reading_passages.title: About History of Modern Europe
reading_passages.text: As Europeans discovered new lands, they created colonies and new empires all over the world.
reading_passages.main_idea: As Europeans discovered new lands, they created colonies and new empires all over the world.

scientific_phenomena.title: History of Modern Europe River
scientific_phenomena.description: For example, Britain had a large workforc e, rich supplies of coal, and many rivers for waterpower. In addition, Great Britain’s colonial markets and its growing populatio n were increasing the demand for manufactured goods. Increased demand led people to look for ways to make goods faster or more easily.

What patterns do you notice about river in History of Modern Europe?

scientific_phenomena.title: History of Modern Europe River
scientific_phenomena.description: provided a new energy source that allowed factories to move from nearby rivers to cities; increased demand for coal and iron; led Bessemer to develop a cheap way to convert iron into steel in 1856; led to improved transportation by boat and train Compare In what ways was capitalism a new economic system? Individuals, rather than monarchs or feudal landowners, now owned most businesses and resources; people could invest in businesses, not just land, to make a profit. More About .

scientific_phenomena.title: History of Modern Europe Mountain
scientific_phenomena.description: Switzerland’s Neutrality Switzerland, a mountainous country in the center of Europe, has a well-deserved reputation for peace and neutrality. Most of Europe has recognized Switzerland’s neutrality since 1815. Switzerland stayed out of both world wars, although fighting raged in neighboring countries.

scientific_phenomena.description: to find a water route to Asia Explain Why was Columbus’s discovery of America an accident? writing_prompts: Using information from the passage and your own knowledge, write an informative paragraph about History of Modern Europe. Include at least three vocabulary terms from Part 1.
Describe an important geographic feature of History of Modern Europe and explain its significance to the region.
Compare and contrast two aspects of History of Modern Europe discussed in the reading passage.
reflection_questions: What new information did you learn about History of Modern Europe?
What questions do you still have about History of Modern Europe?
How does learning about History of Modern Europe help you understand our world better?
How might life in History of Modern Europe be similar to or different from your own?
